ygData.messageBody:
And I have done it with four languages that way, about one complete cycle, you teach on one side, zone, I teach, zone back takes a little over 3 mins and we only go up 2 points, you throw in interuptions, etc. and the fact some people take 50 seconds
to zone then you get 4 hours, we dont all have cable modems you know.
Not everyone zones in 15 seconds, ok.

Ramon wrote:

> From: Ramon <rayf@...>
>
> It doesn't take 4-5 hours. When I've done it, it's taken about an hour.
> Ramon
>
> Tom Matthews wrote:
> >
> > From: Tom Matthews <tmatthews@...>
> >
> > That is true, from an initial one point in a language it takes about 4 to 5 hours depending on zone time, turn off Group chat filter that way it is easier to see improvement (you still learn with group off). Then make a plan to notify the other
> > person since they will be spaming themselves and will not see words, do a wave or jump. You want to do this after you see 2 improvements. So one person teaches on one side and the other person takes the other side.
> >
